title: 2025 marked decline in Mass. fire deaths following spike in 2024, officials say
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Local News The 12 percent drop in deaths came despite the Gabriel House fire, one of the deadliest in decades.
This graph depicts last year's overall decline in fire deaths statewide after a spike in 2024.

Department of Fire Services By Darin Zullo January 11, 2026 | 10:00 AM 2 minutes to read Fire deaths in Massachusetts dropped 12 percent in 2025 after a seven-year high in 2024, according to new data from fire officials.

title: Red Sox reportedly eyeing Bo Bichette after missing out on Alex Bregman
author: Colin McCarthy
bullets: Boston Red Sox Bichette is a top remaining free agent, and Boston is in need of a right-handed bat in its lineup.
Bo Bichette is one of the best free agents available now that Alex Bregman is off the table.
(AP Photo/Brynn Anderson) Now that Alex Bregman is a Chicago Cub, the Red Sox will have to look elsewhere to bolster their infield and add a right-handed bat to their lineup.

title: Victor Wembanyama dominates as Celtics fall narrowly to Spurs: 7 takeaways
author: Tom Westerholm
bullets: Boston Celtics The Celtics, like most teams in the NBA, didn't have any answer for Wembanyama.
Wembanyama scored 21 points in 26 minutes Saturday.
(AP Photo/Robert F.

title: Jaylen Brown blasts Celtics-Spurs officials in expletive-laden rant over lack of foul calls
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Boston Celtics "Every time we play a good team it’s the same [expletive].

" Photo by: Barry Chin/Globe Staff Frustrated by a lack of foul calls and what he views as a lack of consistency in the way games have been officiated lately, an irate Jaylen Brown stood before reporters in the Celtics locker room and blasted the referees that worked the Celtics’ 100-95 loss to San Antonio on Saturday night.

He took a question about the defensive pressure that San Antonio put on the Celtics, mentioning that the Spurs threw a matchup zone at them that seemed like a unique look — one that the Celtics hadn’t seen all year.

title: Red Sox lose Alex Bregman to Cubs, who reportedly sign him to $175 million deal
author: Colin McCarthy
bullets: Boston Red Sox The Red Sox were hoping to bring Bregman back to Boston, but lost out to Chicago.
Alex Bregman is leaving the Red Sox.
Danielle Parhizkaran/The Boston Globe The Alex Bregman sweepstakes are over, and the Red Sox weren’t able to retain their All-Star from 2025.

title: Bruins make history as Pavel Zacha, Marat Khusnutdinov both score hat tricks
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Boston Bruins “We had a good day.
They had a really bad day.
" Marat Khusnutdinov and Pavel Zacha both scored hat tricks on Saturday.

title: Luke Kornet explains why he left Celtics for Spurs
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Boston Celtics Kornet has a bigger contract and an expanded role, but the decision to leave was not easy, he said.
Luke Kornet AP Photo/Brandon Dill Luke Kornet made one of the earliest splashes of the free-agency period last summer, signing a 4-year, $41 million deal with the Spurs.
Kornet had spent at least a portion of each season with the Celtics since 2021 up until this year.

title: Bruins’ Morgan Geekie leaves game vs. Rangers to attend to family matter
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Boston Bruins "But it’s all good.
We have to watch him to see if he comes back tomorrow.
” Morgan Geekie exited Saturday's win over the Rangers.

title: Why Bruins wore white jerseys at home for Saturday’s game vs. Rangers
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Boston Bruins “We haven't had them at home, certainly since the early 2000s on any sort of regular basis.
" The Bruins donned white jerseys on home ice Saturday.
John Tlumacki/Boston Globe By Conor Ryan January 10, 2026 | 6:18 PM 2 minutes to read The Boston Bruins shuffled up their wardrobe on home ice Saturday afternoon.

title: ‘The ball’s in his court’: What Alex Cora said about Red Sox’ efforts to re-sign Alex Bregman
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Boston Red Sox "He knows how I feel about him.
" Alex Bregman and Alex Cora have had a pretty close bond since they were together with the Astros.

Danielle Parhizkaran/Globe Staff By Conor Roche January 10, 2026 | 4:37 PM 2 minutes to read Alex Cora indicated he’s done what he’s needed to do in order to help the Red Sox keep Alex Bregman in free agency.
